Графика приятная,физика NPC не плохая,физика объектов не очень. Большой асортимент оружия,руби,стреляй,поджигай.  Минус-это небольшой донат на DLC включающий в игру новое оружие и скины для игрока,а также однообразие благодаря которому игра может довольно быстро надоесть. Ну в прочем игра действительно стоит своих денег. Лично моя оценка 7\10

Fills a completely different niche than Left 4 Dead, with more of an arena shooter feel and a focus on holding defensible positions instead of constantly pushing forward.  Also, the classes add a lot and the weapon variety is a lot of fun.

Not as polished or immersive an experience as L4D by any stretch, but I find I'm in the mood to play it much, much more often and it seems to have a great deal more longevity.
A great game for L4D fans and for anybody who loves a great zombie killing experience

Super fun multiplayer that far exceeded the expectations I had for it. Leveling system is quite fun, and the play style sets itself well apart from existing experiences like Left 4 Dead. I especially enjoyed the levels from the Potato ARG. For new players looking to get the hang of the game without too much stress, I recommend DOOM servers.

The server browser sucks, interaction with maps is non-existent, games often get repetitive, and the controls can sometimes feel stiff. Plus, anything above beginner level is dang hard (Which sounds pretty sad when said out loud). 
However, it does encourage team work e.g. sharing wealth (ignoring the fact that everyone is a stingy git), rewards gameplay via perks, and is constantly adding to its arsenal, maps and events. And there's nothing more satisfying than headshotting a zombie/mutated creature in slow motion, right?

Wow, so we get another freebie update to KF.  This is the THIRD time they've done this since I bought the game.  Neat!  Kudos to Tripwire for trying to keep the game alive.

Anyway, onto the game itself.  Counterstrike meets Left 4 Dead, more or less.  Great fun, if you are into both of those games, particularly since it includes class leveling which brings you back.

Down side?  KF  is like a multiplayer game straight out of the late-1990s.  Dedicated server with bazillion ports that require forwarding, no fast-and-easy way to run your own private server for friends without extensive fiddling.  Does not use Steam API at all, so no easy "jump into a friend's game" co-op fun.

Do NOT GET ME STARTED ON PUB SERVERS.  JUST DON'T.

It's like Left 4 Dead without any of the pesky story to get in the way of the relentless zombie killing! There are plenty of weapons, stages, and difficulty settings - even if you'd have a better chance of surviving a real apocalypse than completing anything over the "hard" setting. Freaky-deaky seasonal game updates are also a plus. Feel free to speak loudly over the mic to your team in a miserable British accent in an attempt to fit in, they'll love it!
